title: Rolls-Royce drop-offs, designer clothes and all the free drinks you can stomach: The hidden hotel freebies you could be missing out on... and how to get them
text:
1
View
comments
Hidden costs are everywhere in hotel rooms - from the bottled water by the bed, to the once pocketable cosmetics now available to buy from the hotel shop - and it can feel like everything comes with a price tag.
But if you look closely, many hotels are offering guests some very enticing freebies - it's just knowing where to look for them.
From on-the-house luxury spa treatments and free designer clothes to plates of cheese and glasses of bubbly, you'd be surprised what you can bag for free in some of the world's top hotels.
Guests of the Wellesley hotel, in Knightsbridge, can be chauffeured to top London attractions by Rolls-Royce
Rolls-Royce taxi service
Who needs an Uber?
The upmarket Wellesley hotel, in Knightsbridge, has its own Rolls-Royce, which is available to ferry guests anywhere within a 1.5-mile radius and is included in the cost of the stay.

The world's longest pier, the oldest rollercoaster and THAT... Share this article Share Holidaymakers can use the service to be dropped off at top London shops and attractions such as Harrods and Royal Albert Hall in comfort and style, without the additional price tag.
The service is available to all hotel guests, and is not dependent on room type.
Guests can borrow a designer wardrobe for their stay thanks to dress hire service Girl Meets Dress
Designer clothes
Nothing to wear? W London, in Leicester Square, recently announced the launch of a Suitcase-Free service, the Walk Out Wardrobe, offering guests the opportunity to borrow a designer wardrobe for their stay, in collaboration with luxury dress hire service Girl Meets Dress.
Guests just need to call W London’s Whatever/Whenever concierge service and a hand-picked rail of designer wears will be brought to their room.
Also on offer is access to the archive of 4,000 pieces by brands including Victoria Beckham, Alexander McQueen, Marc Jacobs and Stella McCartney, which can be ordered to the hotel to wear that same day.
The service is available at W London and is complimentary for all guests booking a suite.
W London has just announced the launch of a Suitcase-Free service, the Walk Out Wardrobe
Massages
If you’re staying at Atlantis The Palm, in Dubai, and upgrade to Imperial Club you'll receive extra special treatment including afternoon tea, free drinks and canapes and use of the steam room, sauna and jet pool at the hotel's spa.
And tense travellers can also make use of a free massage service, when you get two back, neck and shoulder massages for the price of one.
Meanwhile, guests in normal rooms should look out for free entry to the Aquaventure waterpark and Lost Chambers aquarium, free buggy service around the resort, newspapers and water.
Homemade marmalade
Holidaymakers at the The Gotthard Hotel in Lech, Austria, receive fresh homemade marmalade.
Throughout their stay, they are offered fresh water from a natural spring nearby, and in summer there are free daily guided hikes and mountain bikes to borrow.
Not to mention the 'Hotel Gotthard' duck for each guest to home.
Guests at the Sanctum Soho hotel are entitled to a champagne gift card, redeemable at one of the hotel's bars
Chocolate chip cookies
Cookie fans delight. DoubleTree by Hilton offer freshly baked cookies to all guests on arrival.
The hotel chain, which has 33 properties across the world, gives out around 77,000 chocolate chip cookies each day, adding up to more than 28 million cookies annually.
'At DoubleTree by Hilton, we believe that no matter where you are or what you are doing, cookies have the power to make you smile.
'It’s the reason we’ve welcomed guests with a warm chocolate chip cookie for more than 25 years,' said John Greenleaf, global head, DoubleTree by Hilton.
DoubleTree by Hilton gives out approximately 77,000 chocolate chip cookies to its guests each day
Sun screen and Evian spritzes
Four SeaSons hotels know there's nothing better than a quick Evian spritz when you're sweating away on the sun lounger.
The group offers guests to selected hotels free use of cabanas, umbrellas and casabellas at main pool and beach, as well as ice water, chilled towels and cooling spray of Evian at the pool and beach.
Complimentary sunscreen in a choice of three SPFs is also available.
Wine and cheese
Feeling peckish? Z Hotels, who have properties all over the UK, including Liverpool, Glasgow and London offer all guests complimentary cheese, bread and wine with their stay.
Between 5pm and 8pm everyday, guests have the choice of grabbing a cheese board (all locally sourced, naturally) in the hotel's cafe, or chowing down in the privacy of their room.
It's better than stale biscuits and instant coffee.
